units.title: Integration of scRNA‑seq and Visium data
units.text: By integrating scRNA‑seq and Visium data (Fig. 2e and Extended Data Fig. 4c), we define specific spatial coordinates for these SOX9 subsets: (1) noncycling SOX9+LGR5+ cells are enriched in the surface epithelium; (2) noncycling SOX9+LGR5− cells are located in the basal glands; and (3) cycling SOX9+ cells map to glands in the regenerating superficial layer.
units.rationale: Combines transcriptomic and spatial information to locate cell subpopulations.

units.title: smFISH validation of proliferative marker
units.text: Single‑molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization (smFISH) with RNAscope probes shows higher expression of the proliferative marker MKI67 in the superficial layer of the endometrium, validating Visium data (Extended Data Fig. 5).
units.rationale: Provides experimental confirmation of spatial transcriptomics results.

units.title: Derivation and hormonal stimulation of endometrial organoids
units.text: Organoids were derived in ExM and then subjected to hormonal stimulation with estrogen (E2) followed by estrogen + progesterone (P4) + cAMP and prolactin (PRL).
units.rationale: Establishes an in vitro model to mimic menstrual‑cycle hormone exposure.

units.title: Pathway inhibition during organoid culture
units.text: Organoids were treated with inhibitors to either NOTCH (DBZ or DAPT) or WNT (IWP‑2 or XAV939) upon initiation of hormonal stimulation.
units.rationale: Tests the functional role of NOTCH and WNT signaling in epithelial differentiation.

units.title: CellPhoneDB v.3.0 ligand‑receptor analysis
units.text: To investigate the cell signals operating in the lumenal and glandular microenvironments, we developed CellPhoneDB v.3.0, an updated version of our cell–cell communication pipeline that takes into account spatial cellular colocalization when mapping ligand–receptor pairs.
units.rationale: Identifies putative intercellular communication pathways using spatial data.

units.title: Logistic classifier for epithelial subset prediction
units.text: Predicted epithelial subsets of endometrial organoids using a logistic classifier.
units.rationale: Assigns organoid cells to in vivo‑defined epithelial categories.

units.title: RT‑qPCR validation of gene expression
units.text: Quantitative PCR with reverse transcription (RT–qPCR) using two independent primer sets per gene was performed to validate expression changes.
units.rationale: Confirms transcriptomic findings at the mRNA level.

units.title: Immunohistochemistry of secretory and ciliary markers
units.text: IHC to validate markers of the secretory population, SCGB2A2 and HEY1, and combined staining for FOXJ1 and acetylated α‑tubulin in control (undifferentiated) and differentiated (hormonally stimulated) organoids.
units.rationale: Visualizes protein expression of lineage‑specific markers in organoids.

units.title: Palantir pseudotime and lineage probability analysis
units.text: Cells able to respond to progesterone derived from a clonal organoid culture (E001 individual) (Methods) are colored from left to right: (1) cluster labels as in Extended Data Fig. 8e; (2) Palantir pseudotime; (3) probability of cells to progress toward the ciliary lineage; and (4) probability that the cell differentiates toward the secretory lineage.
units.rationale: Maps dynamic differentiation trajectories of organoid cells.

units.title: Integration with previous scRNA‑seq datasets
units.text: We were able to generate a uterine map of 98,568 cells from 15 individuals by integrating our dataset with previous scRNA‑seq data obtained from superficial endometrial biopsies22 (Fig. 1b, Extended Data Fig. 1b–f and Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Expands cell atlas coverage by combining new and existing data.
